titleStmt.title: Erasmus of Rotterdam to Miklós Oláh (Freiburg im Breisgau, 22 April 1534)

seriesStmt.title: Bibliotheca Scriptorum Medii Recentisque Aevorum: Series nova

div.head: Erasmus of Rotterdam to Miklós Oláh (Freiburg im Breisgau, 22 April 1534)

body.p: 1. He can only partially agree with what Oláh is writing about the affairs in England. He got better by 1 April, but eight days later he was struck by a terrible headache and neckache that seems never to leave any more. He has not been outside in five months, but if he did venture on the 4-5-day journey, he would only do it if he was carried lying down. The Marquess will not do anything, but it does not matter any more, that dumb book cannot really hurt Erasmus’ reputation any longer. Luther has also written a crazy and hate-filled letter. 2. He is happy to hear what Oláh has written about Lieven Algoet. He has heard from him that Oláh wants to go home, so he wishes Oláh luck and is also saddened by it at the same time. His friends should not be angry with him that he is not writing to them, the pain is stopping him from doing so. 3. He knows what Pieter van Monfoort is on to, but he does not care. He is not a friend of his, and although he thinks that Pieter van Monfoort is talented, he is a vacant and sleazy character, and he should not believe a word he says. He promised to bring him his fee of 300 florins, then he said he would only bring 200, but that also turned out to be an empty promise; all the while he encouraged him to write untrue letters, even though he was really sick. He was also freeloading on him and does not thank him for anything.

div.p: Erasmus Roterodamus Nicolao Olao secretario reginae salutem.

[1.] Quae scribisEp. 471. Cap. 1./o:olahus.tei.15340312_1 de rebus Angliae, facile credo ex parte esse vera, omnia non credo. Ad hanc tragoediam non fuisset ventum, si cardinales a pontificePope Clement VII. delegati ante annos septem liquido pronuntiassent. Optarim inter nos et Anglos convenire.

Ad Kalendas Aprilis cepi non bene quidem, sed aliquanto minus male habere, et in bonam spem erectus sum. At post dies octo gravissimus cruciatus invasit sinistrum capitis et colli latus cum humero et brachio, qui sic illic haeret, ut videatur nusquam abiturus. Quinque mensibus non extuleram pedem domo. Ipso die Paschae5 April. sacrificavi in cubiculo. Me a reditu monachorum intemperiae non deterrerent, nisi mihi metuerem a paralysi. Quod si iter esset quattuor aut quinque dierum, vel lectica curarem me istuc deportandum.

Arguerent, inquis, te inconstantiae;See Ep. 471. Cap. 2./o:olahus.tei.15340312_1 utinam hoc crimen in me haereret. MarchioWilliam van den Werwe. nihil faciet Hillenio,Michaël Hillen von Hoochstraaten was a printer who published Herborn’s book, see Allen 1941, 376. For more on his editions, see Conley 2011. favet funigeris. Et iam volumina distracta sunt. Quamquam ille stolidus liber haut multum officiet meo nomini. Hic timeo graviora a sectorum sectarum fautoribus, qui sibi persuadent Erasmum in mora esse, quo minus impune regnent ubique. Luterus emisit epistolam simpliciter furiosam nec aliud spirantem, quam odium parricidiale. De tuo in me studio, Olahe Carissime, profecto memorem mones, nec sum ignarus, quot et quantis nominibus tibi debeam. Id utinam officio quopiam insigni queam declarare.

[2.] Gratum est, quod scribis de Levino,Probably Lieven Algoet sed utinam ille τὰς χεῖρας ποτιφέρωνCf. Apophthegmata Laconica 239 A 10: τὰν χεῖρα ποτιφέροντα τὰν τύχαν καλεῖν.‘putting his hands together (i.e. bringing them forward)’. fortunam invocaret. Significat te parare reditum in Hungariam, quod ut tibi precor, quam felicissimum esse, ita mihi futurum est incommodum sive redeo, sive non redeo: τηλοῦ φίλοι ναίοντες οὐκ εἰσὶν φίλοι.‘friends who live far away are not friends’. Oro, ut apud reverendissimum dominum archiepiscopum PanormitanumJean II Carondelet. sis mihi epistolae vice, eique meo nomine gratias agas, et si commodum videbitur, has illi litteras exhibeas. Vix enim haec potui scribere prae cruciatu. Crede mihi, nullis hortamentis opus est ad reditum: non deero occasioni. Serenissimae reginae precor omnia laeta. Duci ArscotiPhilippe II de Croÿ. salutem plurimam. Danis Danum meis verbis salvere iube. Fortasse suspiciatur me iratum, quod non scribam. Morbus in causa est, non animus. Vale.

Scio, quid venetur Petrus Montfortius,Pieter van Monfoort of Harlem. nec illi invideo successum. Mea causa non est, quod illi faveat quisquam. Nulli amicus est, nisi sibi ipsi. Mihi certe amicus non est. Est magno promptoque ingenio, sed vafro, vano, fastuoso et sordido. Cave quicquam illi credas. Extorquet undique commendationes. Ambiit, ut ad me perferret munus honorarium, quod sex Hollandiae civitates decreverant. Decreti erant Floreni Caroleni trecenti. Ille pertulit ducentos, sed verbis dumtaxat. Me tum graviter laborantem urgebat usque ad vitae taedium, ut scriberem longas ac mendaces ad caesarem, ad commendatorem mihi ignotum, ad thesaurarium Hollandiae et ad alios. Maluissem ei numerare bonam pecuniae summam, quam eo labore cruciare valetudinem. Pastus est domi mei meae cum suo collega dies aliquot. Nec egit gratias. Per QuirinumQuirinus Hagius. meum non dignatus est tria verba scribere. Haec, mi Olae, oportuit te scire. Dissimulandum tamen. Loquacissimus est et posset laedere, quod cuivis facillimum est. Vale.
